entries.text: Personally, I love Agile and Scrum so much I wrote a set of blog articles detailing why I love them so much. But it’s not everyone's cup of tea. Some people yearn for being given a two-week task, going away, and getting it done well by themselves, or in consultation with highly technical and well-read colleagues.
entries.title: Distraction-free Workplace - Escape Standups and Scrum - Perl Developer West London

entries.text: I love working in a vibrant, modern space. If you’re going to spend all day at work, it might as well be somewhere you enjoy being, rather than a cubicle farm. This client has a workspace I’m actively jealous of!
entries.title: London's Trendiest Office Space - Lead and Mid-Level Perl Developer roles

entries.text: Love Perl but want to skill-up on another stack at your employer’s expense? Client is a major and dynamics UK company with a large (and pretty Modern) Perl codebase who have started extended their technical stack to include Scala and NodeJS.
entries.title: Perl Developer who wants to learn Scala and NodeJS - West London

header:
The Perl Toolchain Summit ended last Sunday, and through this week the
attendees have been blogging about what they did there.
There's a lot to read, but hopefully it will illustrate why this is
such a valued event.
There's also plenty of conference news; the season is almost upon us!
subject: That was the toolchain summit that was!
